intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis abjecta, commonly known as the pale pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit and its ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps in capturing moisture from the air. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is a sought-after plant among orchid enthusiasts.
